title: Calories in 6 oz Atlantic Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 6 oz Atlantic salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Farmed Atlantic salmon, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil, salt, or seasonings; 6 oz ≈ 170 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wild vs. farmed, cooking method, portion size, fat content, and additions like oil or sauce. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 6 oz of cooked Atlantic salmon offers ~354 kcal and ~37 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 6 oz Atlantic salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 354 kcal for cooked, skinless farmed Atlantic salmon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 6 oz Atlantic salmon?

faqs.a: No significant carbs—0 g per serving under these assumptions.

faqs.q: Wild vs. farmed Atlantic salmon calories?
faqs.a: Farmed is higher in fat and calories (~208 kcal/100 g); wild is leaner (~158 kcal/100 g).

faqs.q: How does cooking affect salmon nutrition?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling retains nutrients; frying adds calories from oil.
